void SymDump ( SymTable  ip  ) 
  • for each symbol, dumps the names and values for all fields to stderr. field values are dumped in decimal and hex
Parameters:
ip a symbol table
void SymDumpEntryByIndex ( SymTable  ip,
int  index 
)
  • for the symbol with index "index", dump the names and values for all fields to stderr. field values are dumped in decimal and hex
Parameters:
ip a symbol table
index a symbol table index

void SymForAll ( SymTable  ip,
SymIteratorFunc  funct,
Generic  extra_arg 
)
  • calls func(ip,index,extra_arg) with the index of each valid symbol in the table
Parameters:
ip a symbol table
funct a function to be called on all entries in the symbol table
extra_arg an argument to be passed to 'funct'
Generic SymGetField ( SymTable  ip,
char *  name,
char *  field 
)
  • same function as SymGetFieldByIndex(), except that it takes a textual name rather than the index. It calls SymIndex() to turn the name into an index.
Parameters:
ip a symbol table
name a key to lookup in 'ip'
field a field in the symbol table
Returns:
see above
Generic SymGetFieldByIndex ( SymTable  ip,
int  index,
char *  field 
)

returns the value of "field" for "index" where "field" is simply a textual string that names the slot in the table. Any valid C string will do fine here. Consistency is what associates values with names.

Parameters:
ip a symbol table
index an index into the symbol table
field the name of a field in the symbol table
Returns:
see above
int SymIndex ( SymTable  ip,
char *  name 
)

returns an index for "name". If "name" is not in the symbol table, then it is inserted in an empty slot.

Parameters:
ip a symbol table
name a key to lookup in 'ip'
Returns:
see above
SymTable SymInit ( unsigned int  size  ) 

Returns a pointer to a symbol table instance

Parameters:
size the size of the symbol table
Returns:
symbol table with 'size' entries
void SymInitField ( SymTable  ip,
char *  field,
Generic  val,
SymCleanupFunc  cleanup 
)
  • allows the client to initialize "field" to "value" for every valid "index". "cleanupfn" is a pointer to a function to be called for each symbol table entry when the field is deallocated. a value of 0 for "cleanupfn" indicates no cleanup needed. if 'field' is new, then space in the table is assigned for it
Parameters:
ip a symbol table
field a field in the symbol table
val an initial value for the field
cleanup a function to be call when the file is deallocated
void SymKill ( SymTable  ip  ) 

deallocates and cleans up the instance "ip"

Parameters:
ip a symbol table
void SymKillField ( SymTable  ip,
char *  field 
)
  • deallocates any storage associated with "field", losing all values associated with "field" in any valid "index". the cleanup function (if any) specified by SymInitField is invoked on each field value.
Parameters:
ip a symbol table
field a field in the symbol table
int SymMaxIndex ( SymTable  ip  ) 

returns the maximum index used for an entry in the symbol table

Parameters:
ip a symbol table
Returns:
see above
void SymPutField ( SymTable  ip,
char *  name,
char *  field,
Generic  val 
)
  • same function as SymPutFieldByIndex(), except that it takes a textual name rather than an index. It calls SymIndex() to turn the name into an index.
Parameters:
ip a symbol table
name a key to be looked up in 'ip'
field a field name in 'ip'
val a field valude to be stored in 'ip'
void SymPutFieldByIndex ( SymTable  ip,
int  index,
char *  field,
Generic  val 
)
  • sets the value of the "field" for "index" (see SymGetField())
Parameters:
ip a symbol table
index an index into 'ip'
field a field name in the symbol table
val a field value to be stored in table
int SymQueryIndex ( SymTable  ip,
char *  name 
)

returns an "index" for "name" if name in table, else SYM_INVALID_INDEX
